formui_btn_activation_effect: Prevents accidental submission in incomplete states.
formui_burden: Users feel burdened and abandon the flow when excessive input items or irrelevant information are required.
formui_char_limit_details: State limits (e.g., "Max 100") and show real-time counts.
formui_char_limit_effect: Prevents post-input corrections and gives reassurance.
formui_clear_cta_details: Use specific labels like "Submit" or "Next" with visual emphasis.
formui_clear_cta_effect: Users can execute the next action without hesitation.
formui_count_opt_effect: Reduces click count and lessens user "tedium".
formui_count_opt_examples: Use radios for few choices; limit items to essentials.
formui_error_confusion: Users get confused if instructions are ambiguous or error messages aren't specific.
formui_external_link_details: Don't lead users away during input; use new tabs if needed.
formui_field_width_effect: Improves visual balance and provides hints (affordance).
formui_field_width_examples: Set widths matching content (e.g., zip code, address).
formui_form_guide: Guidelines for designing forms that are easy for users to input and complete without stress.
formui_help_text_details: Crucial info near field; supplementary info in tooltips.
formui_help_text_effect: Clarifies rules and reduces hesitation or errors.
formui_increase_conversion: Aims to increase conversion rates by preventing input mistakes and errors, and reducing psychological burden.
formui_info_grouping_effect: Makes info chunks easier to recognize and smoothes the flow.
formui_info_grouping_examples: Place personal info, address, etc., together.
formui_inline_validation_effect: Notice errors immediately and encourage on-the-spot fix.
formui_input_method_details: Use DatePickers or Dropdowns to reduce free text input.
formui_input_method_effect: Prevents format errors and maintains data consistency.
formui_label_top_effect: Reduces eye movement and increases visibility, improving input speed.
formui_loading_indicator_effect: Conveys that process is ongoing, providing reassurance.
formui_long_complex_form: Forms are too long or complex
formui_many_choices: Displaying too many choices at once obscures which ones are required, leading to misinputs.
formui_mobile_keypad: On mobile, set input type appropriately, such as showing the numeric keypad for phone number fields.
formui_optimal_keypad_effect: Reduces input stress for mobile users.
formui_placeholder_label_effect: Ensures users always know what to enter and maintains a11y.
formui_placeholder_not_label: Use placeholders as hints; never substitute for labels.
formui_req_opt_effect: Allows users to judge at a glance what must be entered.
formui_req_opt_marks: Clearly mark "Required" items and add "(Optional)" to others.
formui_spacing_effect: Clarifies relations between Label, Input, and Help Message.
formui_step_viz_effect: Shows the path to the goal, providing reassurance and completion.
formui_step_viz_stepper: Show progress bars (Stepper) for multi-page forms.
formui_tap_mistake: Buttons and inputs that are too small induce mistaps and operational errors.
formui_unresponsive: Users will give up on the input completely if the responsive design is inadequate.
guide_colors_border_desc: Used to show element boundaries or separators.
guide_colors_contrast_checker_desc: You can check if background and text color combinations meet accessibility standards.
guide_colors_contrast_text_desc: Colors for text and icons placed on top of semantic colors (backgrounds).
guide_colors_customization_desc: If you want to change or add color schemes, edit the following files:
guide_colors_customization_pccs_desc: Defines specific color codes based on hue and tone (e.g., $pccs-v1).
guide_colors_customization_semantic_desc: Defines colors for specific purposes (Primary, Destructive, etc.) and dark mode color schemes.
guide_colors_desc: A guide to the colors used in the WIM UI design system. This system is designed based on PCCS (Practical Color Co-ordinate System) for consistent color design.
guide_colors_pccs_desc: WIM UI internally maintains a PCCS color palette, allowing for intuitive color selection based on tones.
guide_colors_pccs_file_link: Refer to src/tokens/_pccs-colors.scss and _semantic-colors.scss for detailed color codes.
guide_colors_pccs_mapping_desc: wim UI manages colors as SCSS variables using PCCS notation (e.g., $pccs-v1, $pccs-gy8-5) and assigns them to semantic CSS variables.
guide_colors_scrollbar_desc: Colors used for scrollbars, such as in the ScrollArea component.
guide_colors_semantic_desc: Colors defined based on use or meaning, used to indicate state or role.
guide_colors_surface_desc: Colors used for application backgrounds and component surfaces, switching automatically in dark mode.
guide_colors_text_desc: Colors used for text, chosen for contrast against backgrounds.
guide_composition_map_desc: A mapping of which internal components are used (wrapped) by major components.
guide_effects_common_vars_guideline: It is recommended to use variables defined collectively, such as var(--transition-base).
guide_effects_desc: Definitions for elevation (shadows) and motion (animations). They convey hierarchy and state changes to the user.
guide_effects_motion_desc: Duration and easing definitions to maintain consistent animation quality.
guide_effects_motion_guideline: Feedback for user interaction feels most natural at approximately 0.2s to 0.3s.
guide_effects_shadow_guideline: Level of elevation is chosen based on element stacking order (z-index) and importance.
guide_hierarchy_desc: Visualizing the layers of components and how they are composed to maintain a healthy architecture.
guide_hierarchy_rules_desc: Design rules for maintaining healthy dependencies in wimui.
guide_hierarchy_tiers_desc: wimui is designed with four tiers based on component complexity and role. This keeps dependencies unidirectional (top-down) and improves maintainability.
guide_layout_desc: Guidelines for roles and placement of Header, Sidebar, Main, and Footer.
guide_layout_footer_content: Recommended: Copyright, terms of service, privacy policy, language switcher, social links
guide_layout_footer_desc: Contains supplementary or legal information. Often omitted in web applications but critical for websites.
guide_layout_header_content: Recommended: Logo, global search, notifications, user profile, top-level navigation
guide_layout_header_desc: Provides context for the entire application and access to global actions. Should include features accessible from anywhere.
guide_layout_main_desc: The central area where users perform tasks. Data display and operations happen here.
guide_layout_overlay_desc: Layer for catching user attention or inputting supplementary info without interrupting the workflow.
guide_layout_pageheader_content: Recommended: Page title, breadcrumbs, primary action buttons, filter toggles
guide_layout_pageheader_desc: Contains the current page title, breadcrumbs, and primary actions for that page (create, save, delete, etc.).
guide_layout_responsive_desc: Adapts the layout based on screen size. Typically, sidebars become drawers and header menus collapse into hamburger menus on mobile.
guide_layout_responsive_mobile: Mobile (< 768px): Sidebar -> Drawer, Header Menu -> Hamburger
guide_layout_rightpanel_content: Recommended: Property panels, comment threads, chat, help documentation
guide_layout_rightpanel_desc: Displays details of selected items, settings, help, or notification history. Can be permanent or temporarily triggered.
guide_layout_sidebar_content: Recommended: Main menu, project lists, filtering options, category lists
guide_layout_sidebar_desc: Manages primary navigation within the application and hierarchical movement. Suitable for drill-down menus.
guide_lvb_a11y_keyboard_screenreader: Using the correct tag conveys the appropriate interaction method (Enter vs Space key) to users relying on assistive technologies like screen readers.
guide_lvb_a11y_rightclick_desc: <a> allows 'Open in new tab', but <button> does not.
guide_lvb_antipattern_text: Avoid stuffing JS logic into <a> via onclick, or using window.location.href in <button> for navigation.
guide_lvb_confusion_submit_text: For form submission buttons (e.g., 'Subscribe', 'Save'), <button type='submit'> is the best practice. It clearly defines the intent to 'submit data' and is correctly announced by screen readers.
guide_lvb_criteria_text: If the **URL (address bar) changes** after clicking, use <a>. If **something completes on the spot**, use <button>.
guide_lvb_desc: Even if they appear as the same 'button', HTML tags (<a> or <button>) must be used correctly according to their function and purpose.
guide_lvb_standard_text: Using <a> for page transitions and <button> for data submission or state changes is the correct approach in Web Standards, benefiting both accessibility and SEO.
guide_lvb_summary_text:
Want to go to another URL?  <a>
Want to send a form or change something?  <button>
guide_lvb_table_scene_a: Go to details page, Go to external site
guide_lvb_table_scene_b: Add to cart, Submit form, Open modal
guide_media_desc: Guidelines for using image, video, and audio components.
guide_pccs_contrast_desc: You can check if PCCS color combinations meet accessibility standards.
guide_pccs_customization_desc: If you want to change specific color codes in the PCCS palette, edit the following file:
guide_pccs_customization_note: * Changing this file will update semantic colors (Primary, Success, etc.) and component colors that reference these colors all at once.
guide_pccs_desc: A list of the PCCS color palette, which forms the basis of WIM UI's color design. Categorized by tone (combination of lightness and saturation) to support intuitive color design.
guide_principles_desc: In wimui, we follow these principles to maintain consistency in DOM management and motion.
guide_rvc_desc: Guidelines for proper usage and differences between Radio, Checkbox, and Switch.
guide_rvc_design_checkbox: Square () with a checkmark () when selected.
guide_rvc_design_radio: Circular () with a filled center when selected.
guide_rvc_design_switch: Capsule shape with a knob that slides to indicate On/Off.
guide_rvc_note_default: Radio buttons should have a default (e.g., standard shipping). However, leave unselected for surveys.
guide_rvc_note_vertical: Stack options vertically and make labels clickable (improved accessibility).
guide_rvc_selection_switch: Toggle between two states (On/Off). Independent setting.
guide_rvc_timing_checkbox: **Requires Confirmation**: Since multiple items are selected, an 'Apply' button flow is common.
guide_rvc_timing_radio: **Immediate**: Selecting one often triggers immediate setting changes or navigation.
guide_rvc_usage_checkbox: Checkbox Use Cases: Filters (Color/Size), Notifications (News/Updates), Terms agreement
guide_rvc_usage_radio: Radio Use Cases: Payment method (Credit/Bank), Sort order (Price/Newest), Delivery time
guide_rvc_usage_switch: Switch Use Cases: Enabling features, Toggling modes (e.g. Dark Mode). Immediate effects.
guide_rvc_vs_switch_checkbox: Switch for immediate effect. Checkbox if a save button is needed.
guide_rvc_vs_switch_radio: Radio for 3+ choices. Switch for 2 states (On/Off).
guide_spacings_desc: Spacings and Border Radius definitions to maintain consistent layouts and shapes.
guide_spacings_focus_desc: The stroke width and offset spacing of the outline displayed on focus to ensure accessibility (such as clarifying the current location during keyboard operation).
guide_spacings_guideline_1: The base 1rem follows the browser default (usually 16px).
guide_spacings_guideline_2: Use CSS variables like var(--spacing-md) for spacings; do not use direct numerical values.
guide_spacings_guideline_3: Use different border radii depending on the component size (Button: sm/md, Card: lg).
guide_spacings_margin_desc: Use CSS variables like var(--spacing-md), do not hardcode values.
guide_spacings_radius_desc: Use according to component size (Button: sm/md, Card: lg).
guide_visualization_desc: Guidelines for using charts and statistical data components.
icons_bold_switch: When text becomes bold, icon weight also automatically thickens.
icons_doc_ref: For specific usage of the Icon component and a list of available icons, please see the Icon Component Documentation.
icons_feedback_clear: Provides clear visual feedback for the selected state.
icons_ghost_btn_reason: Matches border texture for a clean look.
icons_guide_title_desc: Guide for icon design principles and naming conventions across the app.
icons_heavy_weight_reason: Suits important actions needing strong attention.
icons_line_match: Matches icon stroke weight with other UI elements and borders.
icons_line_or_fill: There is no single correct answer to 'Line or Fill?'. It's important to differentiate them based on the app's nature and context where the icon is placed.
icons_mainstream_style_desc: Mainstream style: Outline for base, Filled for selected/important actions.
icons_no_mixing_desc: Avoid confusion; unify parallel features with same style.
icons_primary_btn_reason: Visibility needs to match button strength.
icons_radius_sync_desc: Match icon roundness to component roundness (Round vs Sharp).
icons_size_match: Icons automatically adjust to match the text font size.
icons_vis_priority_reason: Recognizable even when small due to silhouette.
large_paragraph: Large paragraph,Large paragraph, Large paragraph, Large paragraph, Large paragraph, Large paragraph, Large paragraph, Large paragraph, Large paragraph, Large paragraph
layout_aspect_ratio_usage: Best when maintaining a specific ratio for images or videos.
layout_bento_desc: Modern grid layout making it easy to add visual emphasis.
layout_box_as_prop_desc: Use `Box`'s `as` prop for appropriate HTML tags like `section`, `article`, `aside` for structured content.
layout_box_usage: Minimal unit for basic styling like padding, size, and borders.
layout_center_usage: Shortcuts for perfectly centering content horizontally and vertically.
layout_container_max_width_desc: Use `Container` for the outermost wrapper to limit content width and ensure readability.
layout_container_usage: Outer frame to limit content's maximum width and ensure readability on large screens.
layout_flex_usage: Best for fine control over spacing and alignment using `justify-content` etc.
layout_flexibility: wimui provides multiple layout methods, from flexible positioning to strict grid systems.
layout_gap_control_desc: Do not add outer margins to individual components; use `Stack` or `Group`'s `gap` property to control spacing between them.
layout_grid_usage: Manage both rows and columns simultaneously.
layout_group_usage: Best for wrapping elements that need to be grouped together.
layout_masonry_desc: Gapless layout even when elements have different heights.
layout_simple_grid_responsive_desc: Utilize properties like `cols` in `SimpleGrid` for declarative column count changes by screen size.
layout_splitter_desc: Splits layout where pane width/height can be changed by dragging.
layout_stack_usage: Best for vertically or horizontally stacking elements with a consistent gap.
linkvsbutton_btn_examples: Submitting forms, opening modals, changing states, executing calculations.
linkvsbutton_link_examples: Navigating to other pages, anchor links, external sites.
loading_button_desc: Processing within buttons or short-term loading for small areas.
loading_guide_desc: Inform users that data is fetching or processing to reduce wait-time stress.
loading_overlay_desc: When background interaction needs to be temporarily blocked.
loading_progress_desc: Processes where completion percentage is known (download, upload, etc.).
loading_skeleton_desc: Maintains layout while waiting for content to arrive.
media_alt_text_desc: Always set alt text for images/videos. Helps accessibility and SEO.
media_autoplay_limit_desc: Minimize autoplay on audio/video as it often surprises users and violates a11y standards.
media_carousel_desc: Best for banner ads, product galleries, or story-format content displays.
media_custom_controls_desc: Add custom controls to match your app's tone & manner.
media_guide_desc: Effectively use images, videos, and audio to convey information visually and aurally.
media_performance_desc: Use `lazy loading` for performance optimization, and `AspectRatio` to prevent layout shifts.
media_skeleton_usage_desc: Show a `Skeleton` during heavy media file loading to indicate progress.
medium_paragraph: Medium paragraph, Medium paragraph, Medium paragraph, Medium paragraph, Medium paragraph, Medium paragraph, Medium paragraph, Medium paragraph, Medium paragraph, Medium paragraph
nav_active_state_desc: Always visually indicate which tab or menu item is currently active.
nav_anchor_desc: Shortcuts to specific sections on long pages.
nav_breadcrumb_desc: Understand current location and quickly return to parent categories.
nav_burger_desc: Mobile aggregation for many menu items.
nav_context_switch_desc: Best for switching views within the same context.
nav_fixed_pos_desc: Fix navigation positions so they don't move between pages.
nav_guide_desc: Choose ways for users to move within apps, content, or switch views.
nav_pagination_desc: Moving through pages of large datasets.
navutil_affix_desc: Pins sidebars or buttons at specific positions even during scrolling.
navutil_affix_usage_note: Use `Affix` to prevent important navigation from disappearing during scroll.
navutil_backtop_desc: Allows one-click scrolling to the top on long pages.
navutil_backtop_usage_note: Consider providing `BackTop` for pages requiring 3+ scrolls.
navutil_floatbtn_desc: Sticky buttons (e.g., bottom right) for prompts or inquiries.
navutil_floatbtn_usage_note: `FloatButton` is highly attention-grabbing; limit its use to avoid clutter.
navutil_guide_desc: Supplementary navigation elements that follow scrolls or jump instantly.
overlay_bottomsheet_mobile_desc: **BottomSheet** emerging from the bottom is best for one-handed operation. Be careful as Dialogs can be hidden by the keyboard if there are many inputs.
overlay_bottomsheet_usage: Mobile action selection, item details, settings.
overlay_cmd_desc: Search and execute commands or menus.
overlay_context_menu_usage: File operations, shortcut menus per element.
overlay_context_supp_desc: Presents supplementary information while maintaining context.
overlay_dialog_usage: Critical confirmations, complex forms, preventing fatal operations.
overlay_drawer_desktop_desc: For large amounts of info, **Drawer** (Side panel) provides high visibility and ease of operation.
overlay_drawer_usage: Nav menus, viewing detailed info, setting panels.
overlay_float_trigger: Floats right next to the trigger.
overlay_guide: Guidelines for selecting the optimal overlay depending on the UI's purpose.
overlay_guide_flow_desc: Guides through a series of operations.
overlay_hover_rich: Provides images, links, or buttons upon hover.
overlay_instant_action: Instantly presents operations related to the current element.
overlay_long_content_desc: Ideal for vertically long content or settings.
overlay_modal_blocking_desc: Prevents interaction with the background screen.
overlay_modal_usage_criteria: When you want to focus on a task or prevent critical mistakes.
overlay_modeless_blocking_desc: Allows interaction with the background screen while displayed.
overlay_modeless_usage_criteria: When you want to continue work while referring to the original screen.
overlay_popover_usage: Supplementary info, quick settings, context menus.
overlay_sidebar_ref: Allows secondary actions while referring to the original screen.
overlay_swipe_close: Appears within easy reach and can be swiped to close.
overlay_tooltip_desc: Conveys simple meaning of the UI upon hover, etc. (Non-interactive).
overlay_tour_desc: Sequentially highlights specific elements to teach their usage.
overlay_tour_usage: Onboarding, new feature announcements, operation guides.
philosophy_aria_support: Leverages WAI-ARIA to enhance support for assistive technologies.
philosophy_feedback_desc: Provides rapid and natural feedback for user operations, offering a comfortable "tangible" experience.
philosophy_focus_areas: We focus on the following points for design and development:
philosophy_kb_a11y: Supports keyboard operations so all users can use it.
picker_behavior_memorized_or_copy: User knows value or wants to paste
picker_color_input_usage: When users need to paste HEX/RGB codes directly.
picker_color_picker_usage: Intuitive selection from palettes or gradients for themes/designs.
picker_date_picker_usage: Specifying birthdays, reservations, or deadlines with a visual calendar.
picker_date_range_input_usage: Specifying two dates via text input without opening a calendar.
picker_date_range_usage: Hotel stay durations, aggregation periods, etc.
picker_disabled_dates_desc: Dates that cannot be selected (e.g., past dates) should be grayed out.
picker_invalid_state_desc: Clearly indicate invalid states (e.g., graying out past dates).
picker_kb_a11y_desc: Ensure users can navigate pickers via `Tab` and confirm via `Enter`.
picker_mobile_overlay_desc: On mobile, use `Dialog` or `BottomSheet` for pickers that would take too much space.
picker_preview_feedback_desc: Provide constant visual feedback for the selected value (like `ColorInput`).
picker_range_slider_usage: Specifying ranges like price, age, or time intervals.
picker_slider_usage: Best for intuitive adjustments like volume or brightness.
picker_time_picker_usage: Selecting HH:mm separately for appointments or business hours.
placeholder_as_label_dont_desc: Reducing labels to look cleaner (Item names disappear during input)
placeholder_avoid_transient_info: Avoid including information that disappears during input (when starting to type).
placeholder_concise_words: Use short words readable at a glance, and choose placement appropriately according to info importance and length.
placeholder_guide_desc: Placeholders are for displaying short hints or examples (samples) of what to enter in an input field.
placeholder_philosophy_desc: A placeholder is just a "hint". It displays a specific input format example instead of the item name (label).
principle_animation_desc: Animations for component appearing/disappearing should be implemented via the Tier 1 Transition component rather than individual CSS definitions.
principle_dom_desc: When rendering elements like overlays or modals outside the DOM tree, use the Tier 1 Portal component instead of createPortal directly to unify portal logic.
principle_transition_desc: Animation behavior uses common transition classes (fade, scale, slide-*, etc.) defined in transition.scss to provide a consistent UX across the library.
rule_overload_dont_desc: Cramming rules like "8+ chars, including symbols"
rule_same_tier_desc: Dependencies within the same tier are allowed as long as they don't become bloated.
rule_transparent_props_desc: Wrapping components should spread internal component props as much as possible to ensure flexibility.
rule_unidirectional_desc: Lower tiers must not depend on upper tiers (e.g., Button (Tier 2) is prohibited from importing Selectbox (Tier 4)).
sampletextforscrollarea: sample text for scroll area,sample text for scroll area,sample text for scroll area, sample text for scroll area, sample text for scroll area, sample text for scroll area, sample text for scroll area, sample text for scroll area, sample text for scroll area, sample text for scroll area, sample text for scroll area, sample text for scroll area, sample text for scroll area, sample text for scroll area,sample text for scroll area, sample text for scroll area, sample text for scroll area, sample text for scroll area, sample text for scroll area, sample text for scroll area, sample text for scroll area, sample text for scroll area, sample text for scroll area, sample text for scroll area, sample text for scroll area, sample text for scroll area, sample text for scroll area,sample text for scroll area, sample text for scroll area, sample text for scroll area, sample text for scroll area, sample text for scroll area, sample text for scroll area, sample text for scroll area, sample text for scroll area, sample text for scroll area, sample text for scroll area, sample text for scroll area, sample text for scroll area, sample text for scroll area, sample text for scroll area
selection_btn_group_behavior_desc: Grouping multiple related operations. Clicking triggers an action.
selection_btn_group_scene_desc: When grouping independent action buttons like 'Save / Duplicate / Delete' or 'Edit / Delete'.
selection_checkbox_description: Allows multiple selections (0 or more). Each item is independent.
selection_checkbox_group_want_confirm: Confirm multiple values at once via 'Save' or 'Submit'
selection_chip_visual_usage: Display or select tags in a visually emphasized format
selection_choose_one_confirm_later: Select one from few candidates and submit later
selection_default_value_description: Radios usually have a recommended value pre-selected. Checkboxes are usually unselected by default.
selection_deferred_description: Radios and Checkboxes are normally used in forms where states are confirmed by 'Save' or 'Submit'.
selection_guide_desc: Choose the optimal format based on the number of options and the nature of the input.
selection_immediacy_deferred_alt: If you don't want to confirm until 'Submit', use Radio Button
selection_immediacy_needed: Result should be reflected the moment it's selected
selection_immediate_description: Switches and Segmented Controls should be used when settings are saved or views changed instantly.
selection_in_content_filter: Filtering or switching display format within the same content
selection_major_nav: Primary navigation or large-scale switches in the app
selection_multi_item_usage: Select multiple items from a list
selection_nature_multi_alt: If selecting multiple, use Checkbox or Chips
selection_radio_description: Always exactly one selection. One item must always be selected.
selection_radio_group_usage: Payment method, shipping date, sort order.
selection_radio_individual_usage: Individual options (when placed independently without grouping)
selection_radio_usecase: Payment method (Credit/Bank), Sort order (Price Low/High), shipping date.
selection_range_global_alt: If moving across major screens, use Bottom Navigation
selection_range_partial: Inside a screen or changing display format
selection_search_filter_usage: Search and narrow down from a vast amount of data
selection_seg_count_alt: If 5 or more, use Dropdown or Horizontal Scroll Tabs
selection_seg_vs_other: Since Segmented Control shares a similar role with other components, appropriate usage is important.
selection_segmented_behavior_desc: Switching values or display modes. Always exactly one is selected.
selection_segmented_scene_desc: When deciding or changing one state, such as 'Week / Month View' or 'Asc / Desc Sort'.
selection_segmented_usecase: Switch view format (e.g., Week/Month), change sort order (e.g., Asc/Desc).
selection_smooth: makes eye movement much smoother and reduces mistaps on mobile.
selection_space_saving_usage: Select from a medium-sized list while saving space
selection_switch_description: Toggles between two states (ON/OFF). Ideal for binary states like enabling/disabling.
selection_switch_group_usage: Immediate changes for multiple notification settings, etc.
selection_switch_in_place: Switch display mode or filters on the spot
selection_switch_usage: Immediate changes for Wi-Fi, Dark Mode, Notification settings.
selection_switch_usecase: Wi-Fi or Bluetooth ON/OFF, Dark Mode switch, instant notification enable.
selection_tab_exclusive_desc: Each tab has dedicated content and usually does not overlap
selection_tap_area_description: Make label texts clickable and ensure sufficient hit area.
selection_toggle_group_usage: Filter conditions, mode switch, size selection.
selection_toggle_group_visual_usage: Select from visually emphasized button formats
small_paragraph: Small paragraph, Small paragraph, Small paragraph, Small paragraph, Small paragraph, Small paragraph, Small paragraph, Small paragraph, Small paragraph, Small paragraph
tier1_desc: Smallest building blocks that rarely depend on other components.
tier1_role: Provides basic styling, layout, and low-level behavior.
tier2_desc: Independent components with a single function.
tier2_role: Provides unified UI parts for the entire design system.
tier3_desc: Components that combine multiple Tier 1/2 elements to achieve specific UI patterns or functions.
tier3_role: Provides the foundation for complex interactions and state management.
tier4_desc: Components that wrap multiple components to complete specific sections or complex features of the application.
tier4_role: Provides complete UI units and domain-specific features.
token_bp_desc: wim UI supports responsive design. The layout switches based on the following breakpoints.
token_bp_down_desc: Used to apply styles only below (max-width) the specified breakpoint.
token_bp_scss_desc: These tokens are defined as a map variable $breakpoints in src/tokens/_breakpoints.scss, and mixins to easily write media queries are provided.
token_bp_sm_device: Large smartphones or small tablets in portrait mode
token_bp_up_desc: Used in a 'mobile-first' layout to apply styles above (min-width) the specified breakpoint.
token_color_checker_desc: Checks the contrast ratio between background and text colors to ensure accessibility standards are met.
token_color_ct_desc: Colors for text or icons placed on semantic color backgrounds.
token_type_alias_desc: To apply consistent styling across components, aliases with the --wim- prefix are provided for the global tokens above. It is recommended to use these direct alias variables when developing or customizing wim UI components.
token_type_desc1: Defines font sizes, weights, and line heights for consistent typography. Font sizes follow a modular scale with a 1.125 (Major Second) ratio.
token_type_desc2: The scale ratio is managed by the $font-scale-ratio variable in src/tokens/_spacings.scss. Changing this value adjusts the font ratio across the system.
token_type_lh_jpan_loose: Loose (1.8)\nEasy to read in Japanese text, especially on mobile devices and long body text. Gives a relaxed impression and makes eye movement smooth.
token_type_lh_jpan_normal: Normal (1.6)\nThe standard line height for wim UI. Offers the best balance between readability and information density.
token_type_lh_jpan_tight: Tight (1.4)\nUsed when you want to increase information density, such as headings and labels.
token_type_lh_latn_loose: Loose (1.6)\nThe loose line height for Latin scripts provides ample breathing room between lines. It is ideal for legibility in long-form content.
token_type_lh_latn_normal: Normal (1.4)\nNormal line height is the standard for most application UI elements. It offers a balanced density that works well for descriptions.
token_type_lh_latn_tight: Tight (1.2)\nTight line height is specifically designed for headings. It maintains strong visual proximity for related text elements.
token_type_text_ex_large: Extra Large Text (20.25px)\nUses the 1.125 squared ratio ($font-size-2).
token_type_text_ex_small: Extra Small Text (12.64px)\nUses the 1.125 power of -2 ratio ($font-size-minus-2).
token_type_text_small: Small Text (14.22px)\nUses the 1.125 power of -1 ratio ($font-size-minus-1).
typo_code_desc: Uses monospace font to clearly indicate inline code snippets.
typo_contrast_desc: Maintain sufficient contrast (WCAG AA or better) against background. Check via `ContrastChecker`.
typo_filled_usage: Selected states, critical alerts, dark mode visibility.
typo_guide_desc: Guidelines for maximizing readability and accessibility by clarifying info hierarchy.
typo_icon_alt_desc: Convey info to screen readers via `aria-label` etc., when icons have meaning (e.g., as buttons).
typo_icon_aria_desc: Assists text or provides standalone action clues. Use `aria-label` for standalone use.
typo_icon_role_desc: Icons assist text or indicate standalone actions.
typo_inline_desc: Emphasizes parts of text or applies specific styles.
typo_kbd_desc: Uses monospace font to clearly indicate keyboard operations or shortcuts.
typo_link_desc: Navigation to other pages or resources. Use `Link` for navigation and `Button` for execution.
typo_mark_desc: Emphasizes hit portions of search results or critical parts with background colors.
typo_outline_usage: Standard UI parts, navigation, form assistance.
typo_quote_desc: Visually separates external quotes or text to be emphasized.
typo_readability_desc: Limit body line-width to ~45-75 chars using `Container` etc., for readability.
typo_semantics_desc: Use heading levels (h1, h2...) correctly according to document structure, not just visual size.
typo_text_desc: Has appropriate line-height and spacing to ensure readability of long text.
typo_title_desc: Possesses visual weight (boldness/size) to indicate page structure.
util_a11y_strong_allies_desc: Utilities like `FocusTrap` are key to high-a11y UIs. Don't overlook them.
util_divider_usage_desc: Separating content clusters. Prefer whitespace (Stack) for simple separators.
util_errorboundary_resilient_note: Use `ErrorBoundary` for critical components to make the system resilient.
util_errorboundary_usage_desc: Prevent app-wide crashes by catching execution errors at the component level.
util_focustrap_usage_desc: Ensure a11y by trapping focus within modals.
util_infscroll_perf_note: For thousands of records, consider `DataGrid` (virtualized) over `InfiniteScroll`.
util_infscroll_usage_desc: Sequentially load data upon reaching the bottom (feed style).
util_markdown_usage_desc: Gracefully formats Markdown strings into structural HTML elements.
util_markdown_xss_note: Ensure proper sanitization for Markdown to prevent XSS attacks.
util_marquee_usage_desc: For heavy emphasis like news tickers. Use sparingly.
util_portal_debug_note: Only use Portals when strictly necessary (e.g., stacking context issues).
util_portal_usage_desc: Avoid parent `overflow: hidden` issues for Modals or Tooltips.
util_scrollarea_usage_desc: Ensures cross-OS scrollbar consistency and better styling.
util_scrollprogress_pos_note: Usually pinned at the top (`Affix` or inside `Header`).
util_scrollprogress_usage_desc: Indicates read progress on long documents.
util_transition_usage_desc: Centralized management for entry/exit CSS animations.
util_vh_usage_desc: Hiding elements visually while keeping them read by screen readers.
utility_guide: wimui provides many low-level auxiliary components that support UI construction. Though not direct UI parts, they are essential for enhancing functionality and operability.
vis_chart_colors: Manages default color themes used in charts (CHART_COLORS) and styles for grids and axes.
vis_concentration: 'Concentration' per specific segment such as time axis
vis_large_items: Visualization of proportions with many items (5 or more)
vis_login_freq: (e.g., login frequency by week or time)
vis_ratio: Proportion of each item relative to the whole
vis_recharts_desc: WIM UI's chart components are built based on Recharts, automatically applying styles that match the project's design tokens.
vis_small_items: (When the number of items is less)
viz_area_data_desc: Changes in total values, emphasizing volume over time.
viz_axis_labeling_desc: Always clearly label units and axes.
viz_bar_data_desc: Categorical data, rankings, comparing differences between items.
viz_color_minimal_desc: Minimize colors; focus on differentiating items via PCCS palette.
viz_funnel_data_desc: Process reduction stages, conversion rate visualization.
viz_gauge_data_desc: Current position relative to a single target, achievement level.
viz_heatmap_data_desc: Multi-variable matrix density, behavioral pattern visualization.
viz_legend_pos_desc: Fine-tune legend placement so it doesn't crowd the chart.
viz_line_data_desc: Time series, continuous changes, trend analysis.
viz_multi_series_total_trend: Trends in totals for multiple series
viz_not_only_color_desc: Don't rely solely on color; use tooltips and labels for clarity.
viz_pie_data_desc: Composition ratios, market share, portion of total.
viz_scatter_data_desc: Correlation between 2 variables, outlier detection, distribution checks.
viz_selection_criteria_desc: Select the optimal chart for the story you want to tell and the nature of your data.
viz_treemap_data_desc: Hierarchical data ratios, contribution to the whole.
voiceandtone_error: When operational input fails, there is a risk of data loss, or systemic issues arise.
voiceandtone_everyday: When users are handling daily tasks.
voiceandtone_guide: Guidelines to support WIM UI's 'tangible UI' from a communication perspective.
voiceandtone_guide_desc: Defines consistent personality (Voice) and contextual tone (Tone) so users can trust the system and operate with confidence.
voiceandtone_new: When users employ new features, or complex operations are demanded.
voiceandtone_personality: At the core of WIM UI is the personality of a **'Reliable partner who assists user tasks and guides to sure success'**.
voiceandtone_point1: Unobtrusively and flatly conveys only the minimum required info to let the users proceed at their own pace.
voiceandtone_point2: Briefly communicates a sense of security 'It is indeed completed' without extra hype, while sharing a feel of achievement.
voiceandtone_point3: Strictly avoid wording that blames users. Clearly present the fact of what happened and actionable specifics on how to solve it.
voiceandtone_point4: Guides users so they can confidently operate, by breaking down steps minutely and carefully explaining jargon.
voiceandtone_success: When a task is completed, or operational input is properly received.
voiceandtone_tone_desc: While maintaining the consistent Voice personality, the tone alters matching the user's situation and feelings.
voiceandtone_voice_clear_desc: Avoid jargon and roundabout expressions; choose words anyone can understand.
voiceandtone_voice_empathetic_desc: Present solutions from the user perspective instead of imposing system convenience during errors.
voiceandtone_voice_helpful_desc: Organize info so users can tell what to do next at a glance.
voiceandtone_voice_honest_desc: Avoid exaggeration or overly decorated words; convey facts accurately.
voiceandtone_voice_reliable_desc: Foster trust by maintaining consistent wording.
voiceandtone_voice_supportive_desc: Maintain an attitude of always supporting user goals.
doc_audio_long_desc: A component for playing and controlling audio files.
doc_audio_basic_desc: Provides basic functions like play, pause, and volume control.
doc_audio_custom_controls_desc: Customize which controls are displayed, such as seek bars and playback speed.
doc_audio_styling_desc: Flexibly change the appearance, including border radius and color schemes.
doc_audio_important_notice_desc: Playback without user interaction may be restricted by browser autoplay policies.
doc_audio_customization_desc: Add features like playback speed adjustment, loop playback, and waveform display.
doc_avatargroup_max_desc: You can limit the maximum number of avatars to display. The excess will be shown as a number.
doc_avatargroup_size_desc: You can apply sizes to all avatars within the group.
doc_avatargroup_total_desc: You can explicitly specify the total count regardless of the number of actual avatar elements.
